author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: “Sūriyassa, bhikkhave, udayato etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—aruṇuggaṃ;
segments.en: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ uppādāya etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ nimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—kalyāṇamittatā.
segments.en: In the same way, for a mendicant good friendship is the forerunner and precursor of the arising of the seven awakening factors.

segments.pli: Kalyāṇamittassetaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—satta bojjhaṅge bhāvessati, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarissati.
segments.en: A mendicant with good friends can expect to develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kalyāṇamitto satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkaroti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant with good friends develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ … pe … upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kalyāṇamitto satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarotī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant with good friends develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors.”

suttaplex.blurb: Just as the dawn precedes the sun, good friendship precedes the awakening factors.
